thread.title: Auburn basketball lands commitment from 4-star PG Davion Mitchell
thread.title_full: Auburn basketball lands commitment from 4-star PG Davion Mitchell

author: Wesley Sinor | wsinor@al.com
title: Auburn basketball lands commitment from 4-star PG Davion Mitchell
text:
Auburn basketball lands commitment from 4-star PG Davion Mitchell Bruce Pearl Auburn head coach Bruce Pearl celebrates after an NCAA college basketball game in the second round of the Southeastern Conference tournament against Texas A&M, Thursday, March 12, 2015, in Nashville, Tenn. Auburn won 66-59. (AP Photo/Mark Humphrey) (Mark Humphrey) Comments 
Georgia point guard Davion Mitchell has committed to Bruce Pearl and the Auburn Tigers, according to Rivals . 
The 247Sports Composite ranks Mitchell (6-1, 185) as the nation's No. 50 overall player and No. 13 point guard in the 2017 class. He also claims offers from Cincinnati, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Louisville and Tennessee, among others. 
"I love coming here," Mitchell told 247Sports following a visit to the Plains in August. "I love everything about it." 
As a sophomore last season, he averaged 18.8 points, 7.3 assists, 4.7 rebounds and 3.3 assists per game for Liberty County in Hinesville, Ga. 
Mitchell is Auburn's second basketball commitment for the class of 2017. Five-star prospect Austin Wiley of Spain Park committed to the Tigers last month .
